required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Efficacy of Cryotherapy for Skin Anesthesia During Arterial Puncture
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Efficacy of Cryotherapy for Skin Anesthesia During Arterial Puncture for Blood Gas in Critically Ill Patients. SNOW Study

brief_summary.textblock: the purpose of this study is to evaluate the cryotherapy effect by vapocoolant spray to reducing pain during puncture for artérial blood gas

detailed_description.textblock:
Blood gas analysis by arterial puncture is the Gold Standard in the assessment of a patient's acidbase status and oxygenation. This procedure, which can be repeated depending on the clinical condition of patient, is however associated with a potentially painful experience for patients.
The known anesthetic properties of cold can be an interesting alternative to evaluate in the reduction of pain induced during arterial puncture for gas analysis in critically il patients.

primary_outcome.description: Pain will be assessed with the visual analog scale (numeric value go 0 to 100 millimeters and representing intensity of pain from "no pain" to "worst pain imaginable"(1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Ease to performing Arterial Blood Gas (ABG) sampling
secondary_outcome.description: Ease to performing ABG sampling will be evaluated by i)the number of punctures necessary to obtain a sample of at least 1ml of arterial blood, ii) the delay between the first arterial puncture, and obtaining a sample.

arm_group.description: cryotherapy by vapocoolant spray is applied on skin for 4 to 10 seconds ( or up to skin whitening) to 15 centimeters distance with sweeping action before ABG
water spray is applied on skin for 4 to 10 seconds to centimeters distance with sweeping action before ABG

intervention.description: patients recieving cryotherapy for skin anesthesia for artérial blood gas

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All adult patients (age≥18 years) hospitalized in Intensive Care Unit
- Patient requiering arteriale puncture for ABG
- A négative score of CAM ICU scale
- Patient with a score to visual analog scale < or equal 30mm
- Securité sociale affiliated
- consentement
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient undergoing mechanical ventilation
- patient with arterial catheter
- patient with arterio veinius fistul
- patient receiving topical anesthesic at least 2 h before the puncture
- patient with cutaneous lesion (zone of puncture)
- Raynaud Syndrom
- cold sensibility
- Allen test negative
- pregnant
- legal guardianship
